meanings.definition: To twist and turn the body with quick, sinuous movements.
meanings.sent1: The fish was wriggling in the water to escape from the net.
meanings.sent2: The baby was wriggling in her mother's arms, trying to break free.
meanings.sent3: The worm was wriggling on the sidewalk, putting on a show for the ants.
meanings.sent4: The snake was wriggling through the grass, blending in with its surroundings.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's hips were wriggling to the beat of the music, captivating the audience.

meanings.definition: Moving in a twisting or contorted manner.
meanings.sent1: The wriggling caterpillar made its way across the leaf.
meanings.sent2: The wriggling snake slithered through the tall grass.
meanings.sent3: The wriggling puppy looked adorable as it tried to catch its tail.
meanings.sent4: The wriggling vines twisted around the tree trunk, creating a natural pattern.
meanings.sent5: The wriggling worm in the soil signaled the health of the garden to the attentive gardener.
